Υπηρεσίες εργολάβων κηδειών και σχετικές υπηρεσίες
Pogrebne storitve in z njimi povezane storitve

TITLE.P: A Service to Transfer the Deceased on behalf of the Coroner within Hampshire

SHORT_DESCR.P: When a death occurs in the community that is unexplained, unusual or suspicious, it is referred to the Coroner for investigation. Hampshire County Council are releasing this invitation to tender on behalf of the Coroner within Hampshire for the provision of a service to transfer the deceased, where a death has been referred for further investigation. The service will also include removal, collection of the deceased and transportation of organs. Transfers will normally be to a mortuary within Hampshire. Transportation will normally be from a medical facility outside of Hampshire to a medical facility within Hampshire.

LOT_COMBINING_CONTRACT_RIGHT.P: Only 6 lots can be won by 1 supplier from 2-9

Lots 8 and 9 are managed by Portsmouth City Council (PCC) however, Hampshire County Council (HCC) is taking the lead in the procurement process for the wider county. PCC will be consulted with as part of the tendering process and are under no obligation to be legally bound to a contract by HCC.

SHORT_DESCR.P: The requirement under Lot 1 – urgent removals, is for removals that need to be performed urgently across Hampshire. This will be a reactive part of the service. The supplier will be required to perform 24 hours a day, 365 days per year within 30-60 minutes. Once removed, the deceased will then be transferred to a mortuary within Hampshire. This lot covers Hampshire and will be awarded to one supplier.

Fareham, Gosport, Portsmouth, Havant and East Hampshire South are currently managed by Portsmouth City Council however, Hampshire County Council is taking the lead in the procurement process for the wider county. Portsmouth City Council will be consulted with as part of the tendering process and are under no obligation to be legally bound to a contract by Hampshire County Council, however this may change during the term of the contract.

OPTIONS_DESCR.P: The value of each lot is unknown but will not exceed 999 999 GBP over the term.

The contract term will be for an initial period of 24 months, with the potential to extend up to a further 96 months, giving a total contract term of up to 120 months (10 years). The extensions may be for any period or periods within the 96 months by agreement. The extension periods may also vary on a lot by lot basis e.g. not all lots may be extended for the same period.

INFO_ADD.P: Fareham, Gosport, Portsmouth, Havant and East Hampshire South are managed by Portsmouth City Council (PCC) however, Hampshire County Council (HCC) is taking the lead in the procurement process for the wider county. PCC will be consulted with as part of the tendering process and are under no obligation to be legally bound to a contract by HCC, however this may change during the term.

TITLE.P: Removals and Collections – Area A – New Forest

SHORT_DESCR.P: The Coroner within Hampshire is searching for a supplier to perform removals and collections of the deceased. For the removals provision, the supplier will need to perform 24 hours per day, 365 days per year within a maximum of 90 minutes. The collections provision will be performed Monday-Friday within core hours. Once removed or collected, on most occasions, the deceased will then be transferred to a mortuary within Hampshire. This Lot 2 covers the new forest area of Hampshire and will be awarded to one supplier.

OPTIONS_DESCR.P: The value of each lot is unknown but will not exceed 999 999 GBP over the term.

The contract term will be for an initial period of 24 months, with the potential to extend up to a further 96 months, giving a total contract term of up to 120 months (10 years). The extensions may be for any period or periods within the 96 months by agreement. The extension periods may also vary on a lot by lot basis e.g. not all lots may be extended for the same period.

INFO_ADD.P: Lots 2 to 9: a tenderer can only win 6 lots between Lots 2-9. Lots 8 and 9 are managed by Portsmouth City Council (PCC) however, Hampshire County Council (HCC) is taking the lead in the procurement process for the wider county. PCC will be consulted with as part of the tendering process and are under no obligation to be legally bound to a contract by HCC, however this may change during the term.

SHORT_DESCR.P: There may be occasions where Organs are transported between facilities, for further investigations into deaths. Lot 10 is for the Transportation of Organs from a medical facility, normally outside of Hampshire, to a medical facility or mortuary within Hampshire. This part of the service will need to be performed Monday-Friday within core hours. This lot will be awarded to one supplier.

OPTIONS_DESCR.P: The value of each lot is unknown but will not exceed 999 999 GBP over the term.

The contract term will be for an initial period of 24 months, with the potential to extend up to a further 96 months, giving a total contract term of up to 120 months (10 years). The extensions may be for any period or periods within the 96 months by agreement. The extension periods may also vary on a lot by lot basis e.g. not all lots may be extended for the same period.

INFO_ADD.P: Lot 10: any tenderer can win Lot 10 even if they are awarded Lot 1 or have reached the maximum 6 lots from Lots 2 to 9 inclusive. Lots 8 and 9 are optional lots currently managed by Portsmouth City Council. Hampshire County Council reserves the right not to award Lots 8 and 9.

SUITABILITY.P: In accordance with Article 57-62 of Directive 2014/24/EC of the European Parliament and the Council and Regulations 57 of the Public Contracts Regulations 2015. Organisations are advised it is a condition of this agreement that all managers and operatives (including subcontractors) are suitably competent to execute all the requirements and operations encompassed by the Agreement in full compliance with UK legislation.

ECONOMIC_FINANCIAL_INFO.P: In accordance with Article 57-62 of Directive 2014/24/EC of the European Parliament and the Council and Regulations 57 of the Public Contracts Regulations 2015, and set out in the tender documentation.

ECONOMIC_FINANCIAL_MIN_LEVEL.P: As per the requirements of Regulation 58 of the Public Contracts Regulations 2015, and set out in the invitation to tender documents.

TECHNICAL_PROFESSIONAL_INFO.P: In accordance with Article 57-62 of Directive 2014/24/EC of the European Parliament and the Council and Regulations 57 of the Public Contracts Regulations 2015, and set out in the tender documentation.

TECHNICAL_PROFESSIONAL_MIN_LEVEL.P: As per the requirements of Regulation 58 of the Public Contracts Regulations 2015, and set out in the invitation to tender documents.

PERFORMANCE_CONDITIONS.P: In accordance with Article 57-62 of Directive 2014/24/EC of the European Parliament and the Council and Regulations 57 of the Public Contracts Regulations 2015. Organisations are advised it is a condition of this agreement that all managers and operatives (including subcontractors) are suitably competent to execute all the requirements and operations encompassed by the agreement in full compliance with UK legislation.

INFO_ADD.P: Electronic invoicing will be accepted with prior agreement and electronic payment via BACS is preferred.

Interested parties should register their interest via the In-Tend website https://in-tendhost.co.uk/hampshire and complete and submit the tender return documents together with any supporting information requested, by no later than the closing date indicated as IV.2.2).
How to obtain the tender documents:

The tender documents can be accessed when logged into In-Tend by selecting ‘View Details’ on the relevant tender advert and clicking ‘Express Interest’ tab. Once in the tender there are 5 tabs — ‘Tender’, — ‘ITT — documents’, ‘Correspondence’, ‘Clarifications’, and ‘History’. Select the 2nd tab (ITT — documents) where you will find useful information under ‘Tender Details’ continue to scroll down to the heading ‘Tender Documents Received’ where you will be able to view/download the documents.
Please note you are required to ‘Opt In’ before you can access the ‘My tender Return’ to start populating your response.

The ‘Opt Out’ functionality will also be available throughout the duration of the tender process. Opting out will give you the option to declaring you no longer want to receive any further communication in relation to this tender along with the opportunity of providing comments and feedback for this decision.
You can choose to ‘Opt In’ at any time during the tender process if you initially decided to ‘Opt Out’.

REVIEW_PROCEDURE.P: As set out in the Public Contracts Directive 2014/24/EU
